questions.stem: Gases that can be absorbed from the lung, causing systemic toxic effects on different parts of the body are called:
questions.explanation: Toxic gases are those that are absorbed into the bloodstream via the lungs and can cause damage to various organ systems throughout the body. [cite: 728, 733]

questions.stem: A worker in glass pottery has an increased susceptibility to developing:
questions.explanation: Workers in glass pottery are often exposed to silica dust, which causes silicosis. [cite_start]Silicosis is known to increase the risk of developing pulmonary tuberculosis. [cite: 734, 735]

questions.stem: Anthracosis results from the inhalation of:
questions.explanation: Anthracosis, also known as coal worker's pneumoconiosis or 'black lung disease,' is caused by the long-term inhalation of coal dust. [cite: 739, 742]
Unlike heat stroke, heat exhaustion is characterized by a core body temperature that is near normal. [cite_start]Other symptoms include heavy sweating and a rapid pulse. [cite: 745, 746]

questions.stem: Which of the following jobs are considered risky regarding infrared radiation exposure?
questions.explanation: Bakers, glassblowers, and welders are all occupations with significant exposure to infrared radiation from heat sources. [cite: 750, 753]

questions.stem: Immunizations against TB, HBV, and tetanus are indicated in certain occupations.
questions.explanation: True. [cite_start]Healthcare workers and other at-risk professionals are often required or recommended to receive these immunizations to protect against occupational exposure to these diseases. [cite: 761]

questions.stem: Some forms of pneumoconiosis are benign and not necessarily pathological.
questions.explanation: True. [cite_start]Some dusts can cause benign pneumoconiosis, where the dust accumulates in the lungs without causing significant inflammation, scarring, or impairment of lung function. [cite: 761]

questions.stem: Inorganic dust inhalation may lead to cancers.
questions.explanation: True. [cite_start]Certain inorganic dusts, such as asbestos and silica, are classified as carcinogens and can lead to lung cancer and other malignancies. [cite: 761]

questions.stem: In heat exhaustion, the body temperature is greater than 40°C.
questions.explanation: False. A body temperature greater than 40°C is characteristic of heat stroke, not heat exhaustion. [cite_start]In heat exhaustion, the temperature is typically near normal. [cite: 761]

questions.stem: Deafness caused by noise can be reversed by stopping the exposure.
questions.explanation: False. [cite_start]Noise-induced hearing loss is typically permanent and irreversible because it involves damage to the delicate hair cells in the inner ear. [cite: 761]

questions.stem: Cigarette smoking increases the complications of pneumoconiosis.
questions.explanation: True. [cite_start]Smoking has a synergistic effect with occupational dust exposure, significantly worsening lung damage and increasing the risk of complications like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and cancer. [cite: 761]
